```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(broom)

```

```{r}
water <- read_csv(here("HW2_Water.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names()

```

```{r}

```


```{r}
agri <- lm(mc_agriculture ~ reduced_water_use_abatement, water)

agri <- tidy(agri)

meat <- tidy(lm(mc_meat ~ reduced_water_use_abatement, 
     water))

ind <- tidy(lm(mc_industrial ~ reduced_water_use_abatement, 
     water))

urban <- tidy(lm(mc_urban ~ reduced_water_use_abatement, 
     water))

```


```{r}
ggplot(water) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = reduced_water_use_abatement,
                  y = mc_agriculture),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "darkgreen") +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = reduced_water_use_abatement,
                  y = mc_meat),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "darkred") +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = reduced_water_use_abatement,
                  y = mc_industrial),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "black")+
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = reduced_water_use_abatement,
                  y = mc_urban),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "blueviolet")+
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "Q (AF)",
       y = "P ($/AF)")
  
```

```{r}
## Graph demand curves
demand <- tribble(~"water_use", ~"ag", ~"meat", ~"industrial", ~"urban",
                  0, 88.636, 84.481, 233.093, 165.271,
                  100, 37.636, 46.981, 120.093, 105.571)

ggplot(demand) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = water_use,
                  y = ag),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "darkgreen")+
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = water_use,
                  y = meat),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "darkred") +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = water_use,
                  y = industrial),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "black")+
  geom_smooth(method = lm, 
              aes(x = water_use,
                  y = urban),
              se = FALSE,
              color = "blueviolet")
```
